meanings.definition: A small case or container, typically made of gelatin, containing a dose of medicine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed two capsules to be taken after breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her vitamins in a small container of capsules.
meanings.sent3: The capsules rattled in the bottle like tiny maracas.
meanings.sent4: His words were like capsules of wisdom, easy to swallow but full of meaning.
meanings.sent5: The capsules gleamed under the bright lights of the pharmacy, promising relief.

meanings.definition: A small, soluble case of gelatin containing a liquid for use in a capsule gun.
meanings.sent1: The soldier loaded the capsules into the capsule gun before the training exercise.
meanings.sent2: The capsules dissolved quickly in the water, releasing a burst of color.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a water fight using capsules instead of water balloons.
meanings.sent4: The capsules shot out of the gun like tiny rockets, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The capsule gun was a fun toy, shooting colorful capsules across the yard.
